Package uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.connections

Class SCPRequestPipeline

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.manchester.spinnaker.connections.SCPRequestPipeline
public class SCPRequestPipeline
extends java.lang.Object
Allows a set of SCP requests to be grouped together in a communication across a number of channels for a given connection.

This class implements an SCP windowing, first suggested by Andrew Mundy. This extends the idea by having both send and receive windows. These are represented by the numChannels and the intermediateChannelWaits parameters respectively. This seems to help with the timeout issue; when a timeout is received, all requests for which a reply has not been received can also timeout.

Author:
Andrew Mundy, Andrew Rowley, Donal Fellows

    static int SCP_RETRIES
    The default number of times to resend any packet for any reason before an error is triggered.

    The default for the timeout (in ms).

  • Constructor Details

    • SCPRequestPipeline

      public SCPRequestPipeline​(SCPConnection connection, RetryTracker retryTracker)
      Create a request handling pipeline using default settings.
      Parameters:
      connection - The connection over which the communication is to take place.
      retryTracker - Object used to track how many retries were used in an operation. May be null if no suck tracking is required.

    • SCPRequestPipeline

      public SCPRequestPipeline​(SCPConnection connection, int packetTimeout, RetryTracker retryTracker)
      Create a request handling pipeline using default settings.
      Parameters:
      connection - The connection over which the communication is to take place.
      packetTimeout - The number of elapsed milliseconds after sending a packet before it is considered a timeout.
      retryTracker - Object used to track how many retries were used in an operation. May be null if no suck tracking is required.

    • SCPRequestPipeline

      public SCPRequestPipeline​(SCPConnection connection, int numChannels, int intermediateChannelWaits, int numRetries, int packetTimeout, RetryTracker retryTracker)
      Create a request handling pipeline.
      Parameters:
      connection - The connection over which the communication is to take place
      numChannels - The number of requests to send before checking for responses.
      intermediateChannelWaits - The number of outstanding responses to wait for before continuing sending requests.
      numRetries - The number of times to resend any packet for any reason before an error is triggered.
      packetTimeout - The number of elapsed milliseconds after sending a packet before it is considered a timeout.
      retryTracker - Object used to track how many retries were used in an operation. May be null if no suck tracking is required.

  • Method Details

    • sendRequest

      public <T extends CheckOKResponse> void sendRequest​(SCPRequest<T> request, java.util.function.Consumer<T> callback, SCPErrorHandler errorCallback) throws java.io.IOException
      Add an SCP request to the set to be sent.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of response expected to the request.
      Parameters:
      request - The SCP request to be sent
      callback - A callback function to call when the response has been received; takes an SCPResponse as a parameter, or a null if the response doesn't need to be processed.
      errorCallback - A callback function to call when an error is found when processing the message; takes the original SCPRequest, and the exception caught while sending it.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If things go really wrong.

    • sendOneWayRequest

      public void sendOneWayRequest​(SCPRequest<? extends NoResponse> request) throws java.io.IOException
      Send a one-way request.
      Parameters:
      request - The one-way SCP request to be sent.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If things go really wrong.

    • finish

      public void finish() throws java.io.IOException
      Indicate the end of the packets to be sent. This must be called to ensure that all responses are received and handled.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If anything goes wrong with communications.
